In Gaza, 'journalists are dying, and everyone wonders if the next will be one of the two working for us'
subhead: Newsrooms around the world have expressed concern for their Palestinian colleagues in Gaza. Approximately 180 media outlets in 50 countries were expected to relay, on Monday, a call from Reporters Without Borders (RSF) and the Avaaz movement calling for an end to 'the killings in Gaza.'

title: Nestlé sacks CEO over 'undisclosed romantic' office relationship
subhead: Laurent Freixe was immediately dismissed on Monday. The board said it had ordered an investigation into Freixe, who had been with Nestlé since 1986, with the support of outside counsel. Meanwhile, Nespresso CEO Philipp Navratil was appointed by his fellow board members to take over the position.

title: Skulls repatriated from France inflame heritage battle in Madagascar
subhead: The return of three Sakalava skulls to Madagascar, including one believed to be that of King Toera, beheaded by French colonial troops in 1897, has reignited a fierce conflict among his descendants.

title: Posting the journey: How social media became a diary for gender transition
subhead: On Instagram, TikTok and X, many people document the ups and downs of their gender transitions to inform those just starting their journey and foster group solidarity.

title: Political science researcher Antoine Bristielle: Block Everything is 'a movement structured almost exclusively around radical left sympathizers'
subhead: Bristielle conducted a study in the online groups of the Block Everything movement on September 10. He found that only 27% of respondents claimed to have been part of the Yellow Vest movement in 2019, he explained in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Ten years after the migration crisis, Germany assesses Merkel's 'Wir schaffen das' legacy
subhead: 'We will manage,' Chancellor Angela Merkel declared on August 31, 2015, as hundreds of thousands of refugees, particularly from Syria, sought asylum in the country. Studies show her proactive integration policy yielded positive results, even though the issue remains divisive.

title: Malian refugee women recount repeated rapes by Russian mercenaries
subhead: Since 2021, several United Nations and International Federation for Human Rights reports have observed a rise in conflict-related sexual violence acts committed by Malian security forces and their Russian allies.
byline: By Célia Cuordifede (Hodh Ech Chargui region (Mauritania), special correspondent)

title: Evangelicalism in France continues to grow, driven by conversions
subhead: Members of evangelical churches, a branch of Protestantism, are increasing. These believers say they are drawn by a more informal liturgy and the emphasis on community.
